sentences.english: The mother sat up all night with the sick child.
sentences.chinese: 母亲彻夜不眠守候着那生病的孩子。

sentences.english: With so much work to do, we had to stay up through the whole night.
sentences.chinese: 有这么多工作要做，我们只得彻夜不眠。

sentences.english: They sometimes stay up all night.
He lay awake all night, thinking about his new job.
sentences.chinese: 他彻夜不眠，想着他的新工作。

sentences.english: He was pale with fatigue after his sleepless night.
sentences.chinese: 他彻夜不眠，疲倦得脸色苍白。

sentences.english: We used to stay up all night, drinking wine and arguing heatedly about politics.
sentences.chinese: 我们常常彻夜不眠，一边喝酒，一边热烈地谈论政治。

sentences.english: They do not lie awake in the dark and weep for their sins.
sentences.chinese: 不会躺在黑暗中彻夜不眠，为自己的罪孽流泪。

sentences.english: TOBEY-M:Something you said kept me up all night.
sentences.chinese: 你说的一些话，让我彻夜不眠。

sentences.english: He plodded away all night at the accounts but didn't finish them in time.
sentences.chinese: 他彻夜不眠地清理账目，却未能按时完成。

sentences.english: We will but laugh into thy lidless eyes?
sentences.chinese: 我们只是对着你彻夜不眠的眼睛讪笑？

definition: overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
the whole night/all through the night
to be unable to sleep at night
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
without stopping to sleep or have a rest (idiom)
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
to toss and turn restlessly (in the bed)
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
to stay up through the night (idiom)
